website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for customers seeking a simple citrus juicer with an inexpensive price tag.
pros: Heavy-duty glass built to last against time and citric acid
Includes a deep base for catching citrus juice
Built-in pour spout makes for simple serving
Product is especially easy to clean
cons: Smaller-sized juicer than some buyers were expecting

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted, but I didn't give it five stars because I wish it was a bit bigger. I juiced large oranges with it but I can't imagine trying a grapefruit. There is no catch area for the pits, but I don't care about that. I added a photo for sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Has a pour spout that doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: The glass is beautiful and the design looks very practical: You collect the juice, fish out the seeds and pour the juice into whatever you're making with the pour spout right? Wrong! There is no way to pour the liquid out without it dribbling over the sides, underneath the juicer, and on the counter! How could this major design flaw have been overlooked!! The main feature of this reamer is its pour spout so they should make sure that it can actually pour first and then sell it on Amazon. Buy this if you want 1/2 of your fresh squeezed juice on your counter!
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Gal

customer_reviews.title: For a Lemon not an orange
customer_reviews.text: Good for lemons not oranges. This item looks larger than it is. The 'moat' barely hold the juice of one orange. The shape is not round enough for an orange. I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: View Junkie

customer_reviews.title: NOT a lemon juicer
customer_reviews.text: 1. This product is mislabeled as a lemon juicer. It's actually an orange juicer and yes they are different. 2. There is no second level to catch seeds as there on actual lemon juicers. 3. Inferior glass that was already chipped. 4. Handle is incredible awkward and uncomfortable. It was sharp. I would NOT recommend this. Like many of the Made in China products it's obviously been mislabeled and is completely worthless for lemon juicing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For Small Citrus
customer_reviews.text: It works well for about two small lemons or limes, getting a good amount of juice ripped from the pulp and holding the juice thereof. It does not work well for multiple, medium or larger citrus, as the reamer is too small for that, requiring some fancy maneuvering and repeated emptying.
customer_reviews.author: The Bings

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Juicer is too small for anything larger than a very small lime. Forget trying to squeeze an orange. The reemer is too smooth and leaves lots of pulp in the lime. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Klein

customer_reviews.title: Broke almost instantly
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with this juicer. I love these "old school" glass juicers, just like my grandma used. I inherited hers and accidentally broke it after using it over 5 years (she had used it for at least 20). I bought this one (at a price point of $10, now over $16!) and it literally lasted 2 uses before a chunk broke off. I was careful with it and hand washed and it still cracked almost immediately while wiping it out with a dish cloth. They just don't make things how they used to.
customer_reviews.author: K.N.

customer_reviews.title: NOT for grapefruit
customer_reviews.text: When I searched for "Manual glass GRAPEFRUIT juicer" - Amazon recommended this product. The entire width of the juicer is about 4.5". The reamer in the center is for very small citrus (it's a bit over 1" at the bottom and about 2" high). The search and claim that this is for grapefruit is incorrect. The box also indicates that it is for grapefruit. They must have much smaller grapefruit in Taiwan. It would be adequate for lemons or limes.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Pours Poorly--drips juice all over
customer_reviews.text: Reams out lemons, even oranges just fine. The problem is that you can't pour the juice from the spout without much of it running down the outside of the spout and making a great sticky mess. They need to improve the shape with regard to how liquid pours. I'll have to find something else as this just makes too much of a mess!
customer_reviews.author: P. Benton

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and breakable.
customer_reviews.text: First the juicer came already broken into sharp pieces in its box. Conveniently, Amazon didn't require I send it back but promptly shipped a new one which I received and used to make orange juice twice before it broke on the dry trowel for no reason. Litterally, it didn't even fall or anything, it just shattered. I still want a glass hand juicer and will be looking for a different product with some level of quality. This product had zero value. I can't believe it's even sold.
customer_reviews.author: aLISON

customer_reviews.title: Small, but sturdy, old fashioned design citrus juicer
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, thick glass, & works well while I juice by hand my lemons & limes. Just needed something simple, & reasonably inexpensive, & this works! I only wish it was a tad larger. I’ve been used to an antique green depression glass one that I had for many years, but finally broke😞, & it was a bit larger, so as to juice grapefruits easier. This juicer is good for smaller fruits, but grapefruit & oranges MAY be a bit harder to juice.
customer_reviews.author: Happysoles

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The reamer itself is the right size, but the overall size of this juicer is small; in addition, there is nothing to strain out pits. Most importantly, the spout does not pour correctly making measuring a chore. I would not purchase this again. At this time I was desperate because I had broken my favorite one. If I were to make another purchase, it would be Williams-Sonoma Open Kitchen Glass Citrus Juicer, which was unavailable on free shipping
customer_reviews.author: FIGARO

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but effective juicer for lemons.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size for squeezing lemons. I like its broad base and the resistance of the glass for squeezing. While the juice still has to be strained a smaller container I use to store the juice has a strainer. While that container was also equipped to squeeze lemons, it was to unstable and did not accommodate various size lemons. This cleans easily and is working well for me and is very sanitary. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine

customer_reviews.title: Very clear and healthy feeling!
customer_reviews.text: Hi, this is not the cheapest handheld Citrus Juicer, but obviously the best I ever seen! It is so good feeling that the tool is transparent, we can see all possibly dirt on it so easy to clean, this is not a thin nothingness so robust, and anyhow the fact that it is made from glass worth of every penny because hopefully everybody knows that plastic kitchen tools aren't good for our health! Neither aluminium which is a nervous poison... So, glass is a perfect material! I am absolutely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: madscientist

customer_reviews.title: Sight-Unseen Shopping Risks
customer_reviews.text: Had I examined the posted measurements more carefully for this Hic juicer before ordering I would have realized that the largest citrus fruit it can ream is a kumquat or key lime. The 2 inch reamer mound is much too short to juice an orange. Kumquats, anyone? A couple of dollars more, the similar Norpro has a larger basin, but posts the same shallow 2 inches for the reamer. If seeking a 1930s style glass, countertop, manual juice reamer look elsewhere; there are plenty of them around. Perhaps the Hic can ream large grapes, one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: HarvUser

customer_reviews.title: Holds Almost No Juice
customer_reviews.text: Returning this product; you can only juice 1 half of a lime at a time, and then it fills the bowl. That wouldn’t be so bad, but the spout doesn’t pour easily (too bulky), so you lose a lot of the juice as it dribbles down the side and all over your hand. Also as an additional bummer, this is a handwash only item, or at least that’s what the actual packaging says.
customer_reviews.author: VGSB

customer_reviews.title: Makes Things Easier
customer_reviews.text: Senior citizen with arthritis in hands...makes squeezing lemons painful. This Jucier Reamer does the juicing with ease. Plus you don't have to dig out the seeds ahead of time., Ream half a lemon, pour through a fine-mesh strainer. The Juicer Reamer washes up quickly, no hidden corneers. Fits nicely into cabinet or dish washer.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Galasso

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Even the Cheap Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this juicer primarily for squeezing oranges. Unfortunately it is so small, both in diameter and height, that it does not allow an orange to be adequately squeezed. The cut portion of the orange would sit in the juice unless you emptied the juicer every 2 or 3 squeezes. This may be acceptable for squeezing limes or lemons but anything bigger would not work. Also, this morning on my third use of the juicer a large section of the glass base broke off. Now it is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: owllover

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use
customer_reviews.text: This arrived broken; I could hear the glass tinkling as I took the package out of my mailbox. The "bubble wrap" in the manufacturer box was flat - not a bubble left intact. I have since bought another juicer to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: jgee

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided I want to make my own fresh orange juice from now on because the juice from our local so-called "natural" food store tastes like it's made from frozen concentrate. I love this juicer because it's like the one my Mom used when I was growing up. It's high quality glass so I doubt if it will ever break if accidentally dropped, the size is just right, and it looks really nice. It is a pleasure to do the simple task of making my own fresh orange juice and being able to drink it since it actually tastes like real orange juice!
customer_reviews.author: ICKoolG'ma

customer_reviews.title: old-school juicer
customer_reviews.text: As strange as it sounds, I've wanted one of these and been secretly hunting for one of these every time I go to any store, with no luck, ever since I was 18. No joke. Never occurred to me to even look on Amazon lol because I was being a moron lol. Sturdiness gets a 4 star because this is glass. It's heavy but I'm sure if I drop it, it's gonna break lol. Still it's so pretty and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a similar juice reamer that I purchased at an antique shop several years ago. (I dropped it and it shattered.) I really love using this kind of juicer. I find it to be very easy and good at getting every last drop out of citrus fruit. It's made of very heavy glass, but there is always the chance of dropping it on my tile floors. If that happens, I will buy another one. It's a great little kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: palmsandboars

customer_reviews.title: The cone for juicing is too small
customer_reviews.text: Design is bad. Might be good for juicing Key Limes. BUT for Limes, Lemons and Oranges it is too small a cone at 2-inches at its base and 2-inches in height too abrupt to its point. Also the juicer itself is 5-inches in diameter. It looks like a miniature juicer. Although who would want that.
customer_reviews.author: Bramman

customer_reviews.title: The reamer is tall enough for any citrus fruit
customer_reviews.text: I needed a juicer that had a high pointed reamer. The one I had was made of plastic and not very good at juicing any citrus fruit because I could not press the fruit down hard enough to extract the juice and the reamer was much too short. This glass one is high enough and heavy enough to work very well. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Mar

customer_reviews.title: Useful and IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This is a great purchase - solid heavy glass - glass juicer serves its purpose PERFECTLY - great for lemons or limes - I am finding that very often LOW TECH is best. I have used hand squeezers and contraptions for years and this is truly best option when you need to juice a fresh lemon. I am so happy to go back to this old fashioned glass juicer!
customer_reviews.author: SML123

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment! Not worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: We juice lemons several times a week and wore out our old juicer. This one is a complete disappointment! The juicer is so small that it’s useless for anything other than a tiny lemon or lime. The well holds next to nothing and the spout dribbles. I can’t believe that we wasted $17! I wish I could return it!
customer_reviews.author: LPS2025

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Handy
customer_reviews.text: I use lemon a lot, and I was in need of something I can rinse quickly. This is very handy. I have never washed in the dishwasher as I use it very frequently. The size is good for small lemon size, but I also use it for large lemons with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lineria

customer_reviews.title: Not Like Grandma's But Close Enough
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. Although I wanted a larger version like the one my grandmother taught me to use, this reamer is quite functional and does what I wanted it to do. It's quite sturdy and saved me a trip to look yet again at the local Goodwill. You can't go wrong for a non-electric juicing device.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Barnett

customer_reviews.title: It's Small, but Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an old-fashioned juicer like Mother used in my childhood. This is it! It's quite small, so takes up little room, is glass so doesn't affect the taste of fruits I juice and looks pretty, and it's easy to wash and dry.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dippel

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is small but it works and it's very sturdy. One reviewer said that it broke into a bunch of pieces and I'm thinking that maybe it was washed in very hot water. I wash it in cold water only.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Alfaro

customer_reviews.title: Nice glass lime juicer
customer_reviews.text: Great juicer-got it to replace a glass antique one that broke. This one is the perfect size for limes, is sturdy (glass is medium thickness) and I prefer to use glass over plastic so am very happy with purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like it, the only problem is there is a sharp seam inside the glass handle that I will sand down. Otherwise very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: dinodog

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Dropped the 1st one I bought and it barley chipped but still had to be thrown out. Works great for lemons.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D.

customer_reviews.title: Love this juicer
customer_reviews.text: Use primarily for lemons and limes in cooking, gets all the juice and separates seeds nicely. Pretty on the counter or displayed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin B

customer_reviews.title: Glass is best
customer_reviews.text: This little glass citrus juicer is perfect for juicing lemons and limes. This juicer is so much easier than plastic juicers because the weight of the glass makes it more balanced and less likely to tip. Of course I wouldn't recommend dropping it on your tile floor! It will hold about 4 ounces of juice before needing to empty it. It does not strain the juice, obviously, but I don't find that a big deal. This design has worked well for decades and it still works now. I recommend this as a very useful kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: love the glass
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I vacationed in the mountains and the owner of the cabin we stayed in had one of these. I loved it so much my husband bought me this one. I love that it is made out of glass because it is hard enough to squeeze the juice out of lemons, limes and oranges. I always struggled with the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and big enough to juice an orange and have ...
customer_reviews.text: I think it is expectations. I wanted what I had years ago. Strong, sturdy and big enough to juice an orange and have a big enough reservoir to juice a few at a time. This is small. Only for lemons and limes. But it is built well. So, good for what it is, but not what iw anted. Small
customer_reviews.author: Sir Lancelot

customer_reviews.title: Works, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Having two homes, I have used my old juicer for a long time. I ordered this one for our vacation home. It works, but the ribs are dull, and don't cut pulp loose very well. (I like the pulp in my fresh lemonade) Otherwise works as expected. This juicer is a bit smaller also.
customer_reviews.author: anytime41

customer_reviews.title: The Juicer is a perfect size and conforms to the shape of oranges that ...
customer_reviews.text: The Juicer is a perfect size and conforms to the shape of oranges that I squeeze in the morning. The style and design looks a little like the old fashioned juicers I grew up with, so every time I juice, I think about the good ol days. I would rather hand juice, than to run my oranges through a juicer.
customer_reviews.author: jewel morris

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's alright although very heavy, you can tell it's really glass but I like it, although not easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Cecy ZO

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but too small
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality juicer for small oranges or limes or lemons. The middle section is too small for a real size orange and it’s difficult to get to work, perfect for lemon or lime’s but too small for a regular sized orange. High-quality and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Nagy

customer_reviews.title: diameter too narrow
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace a worn juicer. The glass appears solid and looks great. Unfortunately, this "juicer" is only about 1 1/2" in diameter, too narrow for oranges. Our other juicers are 2 1/2 and 3" wide which work much better.
customer_reviews.author: ktn

customer_reviews.title: Squeezes all the juice out of your citrus
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to use, clean, and you can squeeze so much juice out of citrus with it. This style juicer is the way to go if you want a sturdy manual juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bakes

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a juicer just like my mom had
customer_reviews.text: Really 4-1/2 stars because the cone in the center is a little too pointy. I may find it's just right, and if so, will update my review. I wanted a juicer just like my mom had, that doesn't filter out the pulp and extracts *all* the juice. This does that. Yea!
customer_reviews.author: Ros

customer_reviews.title: Juicer is a small size
customer_reviews.text: It serves it’s purpose, but would be easier to use if it were a larger size. I had one for many years that I broke, and when I ordered this, I thought it was the same size. It was much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J. Dederich

customer_reviews.title: Small size
customer_reviews.text: Too small for my liking but I can't find a bigger one in glass.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Smith

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use citrus juicer
customer_reviews.text: I like this juicer because it gets the job done and it's easy to clean. The first one I ordered came broken, but Amazon replaced it for free.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: It works fine
customer_reviews.text: It's much smaller than I expected, but it works fine and just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: MARGARET L.

customer_reviews.title: 2/3 size item
customer_reviews.text: Too small. It’s shaped like my mother’s from the 50s but it’s only 2/3 size! It works but just not as well as my old one that broke
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Lowell

customer_reviews.title: Simple glass elegance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because everything else made is plastic. This is well made, has good splines to extract every bit of juice, and it's glass. Other glass juicers looked cheap and the splines not deep enough for good extraction. Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Misnblu

customer_reviews.title: If you only want this for lemons and limes then it's fine.
customer_reviews.text: This is too small to juice oranges and way to small to handle grapefruits. If you only want this for lemons and limes then it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: im

customer_reviews.title: When life throw lemons; Take it and squeeze
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a glass fruit squeezer for my lemons for some time now.. ai am happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Kat =^..^=

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it 100%
customer_reviews.text: Good old time juicer just like grandma’s. Can’t live without it especially when I’m juicing lemons
customer_reviews.author: Fernrona watkins

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, pretty, and thick glass. I don't think this thing would even break if I dropped it on the floor. It won't hold a ton of juice (maybe one or two fruits worth), but that's not a big deal. Just pour it into another container as you go -- you're going to do that anyways as you can't store anything in this and it's not mean for storage. I like the pour spout, too. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: RTD1999

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my need
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my need. I squeeze a half of lemon almost daily. It appears to be deep enough to do three lemons or more at once. I have had other juicers, this is my favorite. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Found it!
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is exactly what I was looking for. My parents had one of these as I was growing up. We used it all the time. Now that I have my own I use it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: So convenient and easy to juice when you need to work quickly! Heavy glass, a hidden jewel!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, sturdy juicer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, sturdy juicer. I like it very much. I would love it if it were just a bit deeper so held more juice, but it works really well on small limes as well as big lemons and it pours with no spills.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bruckner

customer_reviews.title: Your great grandma's citrus squeezer
customer_reviews.text: This is your great grandma's citrus squeezer that works as good as an electrical one but the size if a dish.
customer_reviews.author: Roland E. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Work well for small quantity of juices.
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine. It servers my original intention for juicing small lemons. It is for a small amount of juices. It won't work well for large amount of juices because it doesn't have a large container enough to handle a large orange.
customer_reviews.author: Kchiu88

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, classic/no frills, works as intended and expected.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, classic/no frills, works as intended and expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Parke

customer_reviews.title: It works just like the juicer I had previously broken and had for years.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered. Works great and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in East Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great for juicing lemons or oranges for recipes that call for some but not a large amount of juice.
customer_reviews.text: This juicer works much better than the ones that squeeze together to remove juice and a lot less messy.
customer_reviews.author: country wife

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for oranges
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars because the product is beautiful, sturdy, and easy to clean but it doesn't fulfill its purpose as oranges squeezer. It barely fits the juice of HALF orange. The compartment is very shallow and I end up with juice everywhere. Very messy. I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo F.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad to replace his old one. As advertised and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Hill

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I like this, but as other comments have said, the part that ‘juices’ could be a bit more sharp in order to juice rather than maul the fruit. It does the job, however, and so i’m satisfied with it. the bowl does seem to hold a good amount of juice, but if you’re doing more than two or three large fruits (oranges or grapefruit) it could be tiresome emptying it so frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: This a great juicer for when you just want to do a little bit. If you need a little lemon juice, or add a bit of orange juice for flavor. It is made very well, the glass is heavy. So convenient. I leave mine sitting on my window seal over my sink for easy grabbing and it looks good sitting there.
customer_reviews.author: KayD

customer_reviews.title: But this is a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I accidently broke my wife's antique of this - hoped to replace it with something of the same quality and style. This did it (but of course I'm still in the dog house) - she finds it to be compare-able to the memory I broke when the glass shattered. But this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry.

customer_reviews.title: Like mom had
customer_reviews.text: Sturdier than the put on another container style. Good weight
customer_reviews.author: Gerald W. Sessions

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted an old school juicer but this one the center is a little too thin to do a good job on oranges. Perhaps lemons will work better.
customer_reviews.author: CRM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking juicer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking juicer. It juices very well, and I like the handle. Four stars because it is a bit heavy, and it doesn't hold much juice--half a cup at most. I use it for juicing lemons, so it's not a problem for me, but it might be inconvenient for orange juice.
customer_reviews.author: Ettie81

customer_reviews.title: Too small for average lemon.
customer_reviews.text: Very small. Is to small to juice a medium sized lemon. The center piece is very narrow and pointy. Ok in for limes
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Loved this!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this!! It's small enough to fit nicely in the cupboard but lg enough to get the job done. I haven't tried big oranges on it but think it might be a little sm for that?? It does lemons to perfection!!! The cleanup is a breeze too!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a keeper (I hope)
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, just a glass juicer. But, quality is good, and juices my lemons and limes, pretty good. Every bit as good as the antique one that I had, that my wife sold at a garage sale, without telling me, until I went looking for it!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Long

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: It's made out of glass duuh!! so it means you have to be careful when you wash it and dry it. I'm super happy with this product... !!
customer_reviews.author: Katarzyna

customer_reviews.title: I love glass stuff so that I bought this squeezer
customer_reviews.text: I love glass stuff so that I bought this squeezer. It's great as I expected. Easy to use, and also easy to clean. With this tiny squeezer, I have at least one glass lemon honey every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Yang

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it one of the best products my mom and I love to use every time we need to use it. The conversation always comes up every time we use it that it was such a great bye and why we didn't buy it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Old School Is Best!!
customer_reviews.text: Old school, easily the best, don’t buy the cheap plastic ones they stink!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Lovely antique style glass lemon squeezer
customer_reviews.text: Lovely old fashioned lemon squeezer. Looks like I remember my grandmother using. It works well, and I prefer it to the metal squeezer I've used.
customer_reviews.author: pat thompson

customer_reviews.title: Would have been great.
customer_reviews.text: Item would be great, if it hadn't arrived cracked. I have no way to print return label what do i do? Can't use.
customer_reviews.author: mare

customer_reviews.title: Timeless!
customer_reviews.text: My husband told me that you couldn't buy these anymore. I can't wait to surprise him! This is great for making fresh orange juice!
customer_reviews.author: megaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: good quality. easy to clean. Although it is a bit heavy, I like its material (glass).
customer_reviews.author: niloofar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Like this, easy to clean. Need to strain seeds with fork or strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Sedgwint

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze those lemons.
customer_reviews.text: I use this about 3 times a day to make a club soda with lemon. I've stopped drinking soda products because of all the stuff in them, and had no way to squeeze my lemons (haaaar). The Harold Juicer is very durable (it's been dropped a couple of times) and I like using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket.
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the juicer I used with my grandmother long ago to make lemonade on a summer evening. I still have hers, of course, but since it's more of a keepsake, I can still have fresh lemonade and my memories too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Penwood

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Doesn’t have a drip-free spout
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the spout doesn’t have a drip free design so it dribbles when you pour.
customer_reviews.author: User_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Small
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is tiny, 5 inches across and 1 inch deep. Not appropriate and ineffectual for medium lemons, oranges and grapefruit. Though the quality appears sturdy, it's function is limited to small limes and lemons. Very impractical.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Peters

customer_reviews.title: Basic product done right
customer_reviews.text: Has a good weight to it. A basic product done right.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: nice sturdy little juicer but you have to empty it after juicing 1 orange. Would like it a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: For the old fashion way of getting fresh juice!
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Item just as I expected and hoped for!
customer_reviews.author: Female, Air Force Veteran!

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's glass instead of plastic
customer_reviews.text: This works well and gets a lot of juice out but it's not very much easier than just hand squeezing lemons. I like that it's glass instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The juicer works very well, the central cone is ...
customer_reviews.text: The juicer works very well, the central cone is pointed just right to squeeze every bit of the lemon juice. I would have given it 5 stars but for a very sharp ridge in the handle that I had to file with diamond files.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer.  Just what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This is an all glass juicer. It is on the smaller side but works great for getting all of the juice out of lemons and oranges for use with our breakfast. It's easy to wash clean. It will serve us well for all of the coming years without any batteries or failures. Just what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Skylark

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great juicer! Sturdy and not bulky. Priced right. Even though you have to manually take the pits out, it's still worth it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara from Vernon

customer_reviews.title: quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: works great for my quick juice of a half a lemon each morning. my spout pours into a glass just fine, easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Shari W.

customer_reviews.title: I would say its better for squeezing lemons and limes as opposed to oranges ...
customer_reviews.text: Similar to one my mom had when I was growing up in the 80s only this is very small. I would say its better for squeezing lemons and limes as opposed to oranges or grapefruits
customer_reviews.author: M. Woodwyk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful! Worked perfect for making lemonade with little ones
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: OLD SCHOOL JUICER
customer_reviews.text: Easy, simple and perfect for the job.... just like the one my folks used. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa L. Ebright

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: great gift for my son to give to his father .
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and just right for those small tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Tango Chaser

product_meta.title: HIC Citrus Juicer Reamer with Handle and Pour Spout, Heavyweight Glass
product_meta.description: HIC’s Glass Citrus Juicer efficiently juices fresh oranges, lemons, limes, grapefruits, and other citrus fruits. Enjoy the delicious flavor of juicing fresh citrus fruits in just seconds. A must-have of kitchen tools and bar accessories, this classic hand juicer is perfect for fresh-squeezed orange juice, making healthy foods and smoothie recipes, mixing marinades, preparing and flavoring everyday gourmet dishes, and creating tasty mixed drinks, from to a refreshing Arnold Palmer tea to margaritas and craft cocktails. Using a manual juicer is easier and more economical than a juicer machine or blender. And, it stores away without using up a lot of space. Easy to use, simply cut citrus in half, place it onto the pointed reamer, cut-side down, and twist back and forth with a firm pressure. The extracted fruit juice will collect in the reservoir. Pour juice directly where it’s needed using the easy-grip handle and pour spout. Made from heavyweight glass to resist damage caused by the citric acid found naturally in citrus fruit. Cleanup is a breeze. Hand wash in warm, soapy water.
feature_bullets: HIC’s Glass Citrus Juicer for efficiently juicing oranges, lemons, limes and collecting fresh juice from other citrus fruits
Made from heavyweight glass; resists damage caused by the citric acid found naturally in fresh citrus
Perfect for fresh orange juice, smoothie recipes, marinades, preparing and flavoring everyday dishes, creating tasty mixed drinks and craft cocktails
Pointed citrus reamer makes juicing easier; deep reservoir collects fresh juice; handle and spout allows for easy pouring
Easier to use and more economical than a juicer machine or blender; hand wash in warm, soapy water. Item Measures 6.5" from sprout to handle
